intro: Landolphia tenuis, commonly known as the slender landolphia, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that are clustered in umbels, attracting various pollinators. Its fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds with silky hairs. Landolphia tenuis is often found in moist, shady habitats such as forests and along riverbanks.
